instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_S5: What is PP1V8_S5? PP1V8_S5 is a 1.8v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged boost to 20v
threads.message:
Hello, 
I have another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, it boost to 20v 0.1a 0.5a 0.65a, then it drop back to 0a, and it cycle again on this numbers...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged boost to 20v
threads.message:
Liquid signs on battery circuitry?
Be sure to have a good battery connected on this board.

Check if all secondary power rails appear pulse at least.
Also check for short where no pulse seen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged boost to 20v
threads.message:
Sorry for late replay 
i Found <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S5</SIGNAL> Missing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged boost to 20v
threads.message:
Check for short to ground.
There are many chips connected...
